translated: The perfection of ritual, the perfection of morality, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of view will be lost.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said:

analyzed: 'dir cig shos kyi gang zag gi lta ba ni sla'i stong pa nyid la skyon du bzung ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Here, the view of the other person is easy, but it is not so when emptiness is taken as a fault.

original: stong pa nyid la skyon du bzung bas shes bya'i dngos po la rmongs shing shes bya thams cad la skur pa 'debs pas ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: chos don du gnyer ba dang du: kha la rnam par grol ba'i don du gnyer ba gzhan la slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos don du gnyer ba dang du: kha la rnam par grol ba'i don du gnyer ba gzhan la slu bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la lhod par 'gyur zhing gang zag tu lta ba can ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: One becomes lax in the bases of training, but one who has the view of a person does not.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: lus ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: zhi ba'i spyod lam la sogs pa la rjes su mthun par mi gnas pa'i phyir ma bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i spyod lam la sogs pa la rjes su mthun par mi gnas pa'i phyir ma bsgoms pa'o //
translated: It is not cultivated because one does not abide in accordance with the practice of tranquility and so on.

original: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams la lhod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rnams la lhod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: sems ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pas yangs pa med pa'i phyir dang myur du ting nge 'dzin la mngon par phyogs par 'dod nus pa ste de med pas so //üîΩgang zhig yang dus gcig tu de rnams la srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang // yid 'byung ba la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba de lta na yang ji lta ba bzhin @106a * //
analyzed: sems ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang yang dag par ldan pas yangs pa med pa'i phyir dang myur du ting nge 'dzin la mngon par phyogs par 'dod nus pa ste de med pas so // gang zhig yang dus gcig tu de rnams la srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang // yid 'byung ba la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba de lta na yang ji lta ba bzhin @106a * //
translated: The phrase not cultivating the mind means that one is not able to quickly direct oneself toward meditative concentration because one does not have the expansive mind that is associated with morality.

original: ma yin pa'i don la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir skyon gyi gnyen po ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i don la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir skyon gyi gnyen po ma yin te /
translated: Even if one were to have these three at the same time, they would not be antidotes to the faults because they are focused on a meaning that is not as it is.

original: de bas na log pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes sems ma bsgoms pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na log pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes sems ma bsgoms pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they do not cultivate meditative concentration, because they do not cultivate the mind.

original: shes rab ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ma bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not cultivate wisdom, because they do not fully understand the selflessness of dharmas as it is.

original: shes rab 'chal ba ni phyin ci log gi don la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba ni phyin ci log gi don la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have bad wisdom, because they adhere to the meaning of what is erroneous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lug ltar lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can ni gzhan gyis legs par smras pa mi nyan pa'i phyir dang rang nyid kyis kyang legs par smra ba mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lug ltar lkugs pa'i rang bzhin can ni gzhan gyis legs par smras pa mi nyan pa'i phyir dang rang nyid kyis kyang legs par smra ba mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, they are like dumb sheep, because they do not listen to the good advice of others and because they do not themselves give good advice.

original: shes rab yongs su nyams pa ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyams pa ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have lost their wisdom, because they have lost what has not been obtained, because they have lost supramundane wisdom.

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la gzugs rnam par 'dzin pa dang / gzugs mi rtag pa nyid ces ston par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gtso bo'o //

translated: The words these and so on refer to the apprehension of form and the teaching of the impermanence of form. The words a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom are the main point.

original: 'di rnams kyang theg pa chen po nyid phyin ci log tu 'chad pa po rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang theg pa chen po nyid phyin ci log tu 'chad pa po rnams so //
translated: These are the ones who explain the Great Vehicle in a distorted way.

original: de bas na gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa ste phyi rol gyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa ste phyi rol gyi don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of form is a cognition, not an external object.

original: de lta na yang kha cig 'don pa yin te /üîΩphyi rol bzhin du snang rnams la //
analyzed: de lta na yang kha cig 'don pa yin te / phyi rol bzhin du snang rnams la //
translated: Even so, some recite the following:üîΩThe imagined form is the appearance

original: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brjod do //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni gzugs brjod do // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as external things, just like the cognition.

original: gal te rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag par gyur na de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yang ma skyes pa rnams la de bas na rnam par 'jig pa mthong ba chos gsum dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag par gyur na de'i tshe 'jig pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yang ma skyes pa rnams la de bas na rnam par 'jig pa mthong ba chos gsum dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the characteristic of apprehension were impermanent, then at that time, destruction itself would be destroyed. And since the non-arisen ones would be destroyed, the three phenomena would be observed.

original: de rnams kyang skye ba dang rnam par 'jig pa dag go //
analyzed: de rnams kyang skye ba dang rnam par 'jig pa dag go //
translated: and those are birth and destruction.

original: de'i phyir don dam pa po chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa po chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, is not seen as ultimate.

original: rnam par 'dzin pa la mi rtag pa nyid dgag par byed pa ni koo shi ka yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par 'dzin pa la mi rtag pa nyid dgag par byed pa ni koo shi ka yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: In order to refute the impermanence of grasping, he says, ‚ÄúKau≈õika, moreover,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi rtag pa ni du tsam yin gang zhig theg pa chen po dang chen mo rnams la gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni du tsam yin gang zhig theg pa chen po dang chen mo rnams la gsungs pa /
translated: How many are impermanent? Which are taught in the MahƒÅyƒÅna?

original: de lta na yang der 'don pa yin te gzugs brnyan ni ji ltar ston par mi 'gyur te gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang der 'don pa yin te gzugs brnyan ni ji ltar ston par mi 'gyur te gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Even so, it is recited there. How could a reflection not be taught? Form is empty by nature.

original: gang zhig gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The nature of form is non-existence.

original: gang zhig yang dngos po @106b med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yang dngos po @106b med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: And that which is non-existent is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de la gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa lta ga la yod /
translated: If form itself does not exist there, how could permanence exist?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

original: gang zhig yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zhig 'di ltar nye bar ston par byed pa de ni gzugs brnyan nye bar ston par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang zhig 'di ltar nye bar ston par byed pa de ni gzugs brnyan nye bar ston par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is the intrinsic nature of consciousness is non-existent‚Äù and so on, and so forth.

original: gal te 'dir rnam par 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa'i don mi 'gyur na de'i phyir rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa mi rtag pa zhes shugs kyis smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dir rnam par 'jig pa ni mi rtag pa'i don mi 'gyur na de'i phyir rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa mi rtag pa zhes shugs kyis smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If here the meaning of impermanence is not destruction, then permanence would be the meaning of impermanence, since it is said by implication that a non-existent thing is permanent.

original: don 'di ni 'phags pa mgon po byams pas dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang rang gi bstan bcos rnams dang / de'i bzhed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang stong pa nyid kyi don gang nyid bstan pa de nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni 'phags pa mgon po byams pas dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnams dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang rang gi bstan bcos rnams dang / de'i bzhed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis kyang stong pa nyid kyi don gang nyid bstan pa de nyid ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of emptiness that they teach is the perfection of wisdom that is free from error.

original: de la gzhan dag theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag theg pa chen po pa rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: In this regard, others have taught that the MahƒÅyƒÅna is an entity that is a reflection,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i gzugs brnyan mtshan nyid thams cad du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of the TathƒÅgata that are taught by the Blessed One are seen to be like a reflection.

original: de lta na yang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa shes par smra ba rnams kyis re zhig rang gis brtags pa nyid kyi grub mtha' gzhan rnams slu ba'i don du mgon po byams pa'i bzhed pa log pa nyid du bsgrags nas brjod cing snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa shes par smra ba rnams kyis re zhig rang gis brtags pa nyid kyi grub mtha' gzhan rnams slu ba'i don du mgon po byams pa'i bzhed pa log pa nyid du bsgrags nas brjod cing snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, the Proponents of Consciousness with Features, having proclaimed the position of the Lord Maitreya to be false, have spoken and written about it as if it were a philosophical tenet of their own invention.

original: 'di nyid du rgyu gzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo la gang zhig brtags pa 'dzin pa dang las dang byed pa po yod pa der yang gang zhig gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo yongs su grub pa thams cad du rgyal tshab kyi rgyal pos gsungs pa
analyzed: 'di nyid du rgyu gzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo la gang zhig brtags pa 'dzin pa dang las dang byed pa po yod pa der yang gang zhig gnyis kyis dben pa'i ngo bo yongs su grub pa thams cad du rgyal tshab kyi rgyal pos gsungs pa
translated: In this very text, the regent king has said that whatever is imagined in the various natures of other-dependent causes, such as the apprehender, object, and agent, is also empty of duality, and that the nature of the thoroughly established is present everywhere:

original: / 'di ni gzugs brnyan te gzugs mi rtag pa ji srid du rnam par shes pa rnam par 'jig pa dang rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa zhes nye bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: / 'di ni gzugs brnyan te gzugs mi rtag pa ji srid du rnam par shes pa rnam par 'jig pa dang rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa zhes nye bar ston pa yin no //
translated: This is a reflection. It is a teaching that form is impermanent, as long as consciousness is destroyed, and that consciousness is impermanent.

analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúForm‚Äù is the representation that appears as form.

analyzed: de nyid phung po lnga'i rnam par gzhag pa la gzugs zhes te de rnams kyi 'dod pa nyid do //

original: 'di ltar ni brjod pa yin te snga ma dang phyi ma rtogs par nges pa nyid ni rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo rtogs pa de smra ba po rnams kyis mngon par brjod par bya ste /

original: snga ma la yang ma yin phyi ma la yang ma yin /
analyzed: snga ma la yang ma yin phyi ma la yang ma yin /

translated: It is not the apprehension of the conventional experience of the nature of cause and effect, which is the apprehension of this from that, arisen from the latent predispositions of both.

analyzed: thams cad du rang rig tsam la nus pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi gtam la 'dris pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te yang 'di tsam gzhan gyi blos rtogs su zin kyang de lta na yang 'di tsam dang ldan pas 'di tsam dang ldan pa nyid 'di tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if this much is realized by the mind of another, still, one who possesses this much is not this much, who possesses this much.

original: gcig tu 'dzin pa'i blos @107b ni gcig kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir rtogs pa po gzhan gang yin pa rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //

translated: The mind that apprehends a single thing is not a single thing. Therefore, the one who understands, the understanding, and the one who possesses understanding are all different.

original: de'i stobs kyis gang gi yul gcig ma yin te de bas na de dag la yang rang gi ngo bo tsam yul yin la 'dis ni snga phyi'i ngo bo'i rtogs pa ni sun 'byin par 'dzin no //

translated: By the power of that, the object is not a single thing. Therefore, even for them, the object is merely the intrinsic nature. This refutes the understanding of the intrinsic nature of the prior and subsequent.

original: snga phyi nyid 'ga' zhig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gang gis de'i bdag nyid can rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo zhes bsam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga phyi nyid 'ga' zhig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gang gis de'i bdag nyid can rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo zhes bsam par 'gyur ro //

original: gang gi phyir 'di mngon sum tsam gyis bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di mngon sum tsam gyis bya ba ma yin no //

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa rtse gcig pa nyid la ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa rtse gcig pa nyid la ni /
translated: In the one-pointed awareness of one's own nature,

analyzed: gang du tha dad pa'i snga phyi'i ngo bo'i sbyor ba'o //

original: blo ni snga min phyi ma min //

original: de ltar 'os pa gnas pa khong stong dag pas yang //
analyzed: de ltar 'os pa gnas pa khong stong dag pas yang //
translated: Thus, the one who is worthy, who is empty inside, who is pure,

analyzed: gang phyir nam yang rtogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin te //
translated: Is never an object of conception.

original: dus gzhan la ni gang gis dus su gang gis mthong ba ste //
analyzed: dus gzhan la ni gang gis dus su gang gis mthong ba ste //
translated: At another time, by whom is it seen?

original: rgyu la the tshom gal te mi gnod pa ni de //
analyzed: rgyu la the tshom gal te mi gnod pa ni de //
translated: If the cause is not harmed by doubt, then

original: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang la ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba gang la ni //
translated: Where all objects of observation are completely pacified,

original: de la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad nyid yin te //
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad nyid yin te //

analyzed: ji ltar dmigs bya ba mi dmigs pa yi dus la ni //

analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu la'o //

original: de'i phyir rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo 'di ni snga phyir gyur pa 'ga' zhig la mi dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i srid pa dang bral ba phyi rol gyi don bzhin du med pa nyid ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi rnam par 'jig pa mi rtag pa zhes de rnams la thal ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid la rnam rtog gi shes pa'i yul nyid kyis skye ba la sogs pa rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir chad pa med pa dang rtag pa yang med pa zag pa yang med pa'i mthus

translated: This is how it is: Even those who desire liberation should accept this apprehension of tenets as the cause of the mind's liberation from afflictions and suffering, so that it may arise in the future.

original: gzhan yang gang zhig 'di smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig 'di smras pa /
translated: Moreover, someone may say,

analyzed: don dam par rang rig tsam la nus pa nyid kyi phyir blo rnams kyi tha dad par snga phyi'i ngo bo sbyor ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te snga phyi'i dngos pos nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i yang dag par rig pa rnams nyid yod pa ma yin zhes 'dod na /

analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na nyid sgom pa'i goms pas skye ba thob pa yon tan dang skyon thams cad kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mthar thug pa'i rten ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs yod par mi 'gyur zhes nye bar bzung nas de kho na nyid
translated: then, because of that, the attainment of birth through the cultivation of meditation on reality would not exist, and the final increase and decrease of all good qualities and faults would not exist.

analyzed: nges pa'i phyir khyed cag 'jug pa'o //
translated: Thus, you should engage in ascertaining reality.

original: de 'jig rten rgyang pan pa las kyang khyed cag lhag pa ste /
analyzed: de 'jig rten rgyang pan pa las kyang khyed cag lhag pa ste /
translated: You are superior to the LokƒÅyatas in this way.

analyzed: gang zhig skye ba 'di la ma mthong ba nyid 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa mi 'dod pa de yang skye ba las brtsams nas mthong ba'i rnam par rig pa thams cad do ;

analyzed: /'on te snga phyir gyur pa'i yang dag par rig pa rnams yod pa kho na ste /
translated: But all right cognitions that arise from birth exist.

original: snga phyi nyid ni gcig pu 'gag pa yin te /
analyzed: snga phyi nyid ni gcig pu 'gag pa yin te /
translated: The past and future are only one, and that is stopped.

original: de ci'i phyir snga phyi yang dag par rig pa rnams da lta nyid du yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir snga phyi yang dag par rig pa rnams da lta nyid du yod pa yin no //

original: de ltar khas len pa na nu ma 'thung ba dang gan rkyal du nyal ba dang / rgas pas 'khogs pa dang / byis par byas pa dang / rgas pa'i grogs po bdag nyid ci'i phyir mi lta /

translated: If you accept that, then why don‚Äôt you see the person who is a baby, who is lying on its back, who is an old man, and who is a friend of the old man?

analyzed: 'on te de dang de'i yang dag par rig pa rnams de dang de'i dus la yod pa yin na snga phyi'i dngos pos stong pa 'di ci zhig brjod /
translated: But if the cognitions of each of those exist at each of those times, then why do you say that this person is empty of prior and subsequent existence?

original: yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi @108b dus tha dad pa nyid kyi snga phyi'i ngo bo don de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi @108b dus tha dad pa nyid kyi snga phyi'i ngo bo don de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The prior and subsequent natures of the different times of the cognitions are the very same object.

original: rgyu nyid ni snga ma'i ngo bo nges par spangs nas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni snga ma'i ngo bo nges par spangs nas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause does not exist after definitely abandoning the prior nature.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyang phyi ma'i ngo bo'i nges par spangs nas cung zad gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyang phyi ma'i ngo bo'i nges par spangs nas cung zad gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo grub pa yin no //
translated: And the effect itself, having abandoned the determination of the nature of the later, does not exist as even the slightest other. Thus the nature of cause and effect is established.

original: 'on te rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo kun rdzob pa yang gang gis mi 'dod pa de nyid du ni yod pa ma yin zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo kun rdzob pa yang gang gis mi 'dod pa de nyid du ni yod pa ma yin zhes smra'o //
translated: But if the nature of cause and effect is not accepted even conventionally, then it is said that it does not exist even in that way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: Therefore, even the contradiction of one‚Äôs own words,

analyzed: de nyid du ma yin zhes khyad par gyis don dam par 'grib par byed pa'i blo kun rdzob ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: since it is said that the mind that diminishes in reality is the conventional, is not in reality.

original: de la gsal ba don dam par smra ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: de la gsal ba don dam par smra ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid kun rdzob ste /
translated: In that regard, the conceptualization of those who propound that manifestation is ultimate is the conventional.

analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi don bzhin du yul gang zhig gcig pa ni rnam par rtog pa nyid do //

analyzed: nam gyi tshe gsal ba de nyid kun rdzob ma yin zhes brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: When should it be said that that manifestation is not the conventional?

original: de bas na mtho ris sam thar pa bdag la 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba kho bo la rnam par rtog pa nyid gcig pu ste /
analyzed: de bas na mtho ris sam thar pa bdag la 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba kho bo la rnam par rtog pa nyid gcig pu ste /
translated: Therefore, the thought ‚ÄúI will attain heaven or liberation‚Äù is just a conceptual thought for me.

original: gsal ba ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nam gyi tshe na yang 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes don med pa sgrub par byed pa rnams la sgrub pa ste rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: gsal ba ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nam gyi tshe na yang 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes don med pa sgrub par byed pa rnams la sgrub pa ste rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis so //
translated: When a clear appearance of heaven, etc. never occurs, you prove what is already established for us, i.e., that conceptual thought alone is the cause of heaven, etc.

original: gzhan du na yang rnyed par sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yang rnyed par sla ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is easy to find other examples of conceptual thoughts that are the cause of heaven, etc.

original: gsal ba khas len na de nyid gdug pa'i bdag nyid can rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gsal ba khas len na de nyid gdug pa'i bdag nyid can rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: If you accept that a clear appearance is the cause of heaven, etc., then that very clear appearance, which has the nature of an object of abandonment, is the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'on te spros pa 'ga' zhig gang gi bden pa rig par bya ba ste //
analyzed: 'on te spros pa 'ga' zhig gang gi bden pa rig par bya ba ste //
translated: Or, if some conceptual thought is the cause of heaven, etc.,

original: de ni de yi kun rdzob nyid du che bar slar ni grags par byed //
analyzed: de ni de yi kun rdzob nyid du che bar slar ni grags par byed //
translated: then that conceptual thought is renowned as the conventional cause of heaven, etc.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa kun rdzob yin na gsal ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa kun rdzob yin na gsal ba ma yin te //
translated: If conceptual thought is the conventional, then a clear appearance is not the conventional,

original: mtho ris thar pa dag la skur pa 'debs pas kye ma khyod ni bcom //
analyzed: mtho ris thar pa dag la skur pa 'debs pas kye ma khyod ni bcom //
translated: because you deprecate heaven and liberation. Alas! You are destroyed.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa don dam par yod par smra ba rnams kyi rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo ni don dam pa pa nyid de rigs mi 'dra ba tsam gyis gzhan du byed par 'dod cing slar 'di ltar rab tu sad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa don dam par yod par smra ba rnams kyi rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo ni don dam pa pa nyid de rigs mi 'dra ba tsam gyis gzhan du byed par 'dod cing slar 'di ltar rab tu sad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of cause and effect of those who maintain that consciousness exists ultimately is ultimate, and they maintain that it is different by mere difference in type.

original: de lta na yang rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi 'dzin par byed cing rang rang gi ngo bo tsam la nub pa nyid kyis 'di las 'di zhes gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi 'dzin par byed cing rang rang gi ngo bo tsam la nub pa nyid kyis 'di las 'di zhes gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it should be understood as follows: even so, it is not possible to apprehend this from that, because all cognitions are grasped by the apprehender, and by the mere submergence of their own nature.

original: tshad ma med par gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa ma yin zhes brjod par bya ba ste dus thams cad @109a * //
analyzed: tshad ma med par gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa ma yin zhes brjod par bya ba ste dus thams cad @109a * //
translated: It should be said that the object of comprehension is not established without a valid means of knowledge, and at all times

original: du shes pa'i tshogs 'di dus thams cad du gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rim gyis skye ba ma yin te re zhig snga phyi'i ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du shes pa'i tshogs 'di dus thams cad du gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rim gyis skye ba ma yin te re zhig snga phyi'i ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: this collection of consciousnesses is not of the nature of one at all times, and it does not arise gradually. First, the prior and subsequent natures do not exist.

original: de bas na snga ma'am phyi ma'i blo bdag nyid snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba'i snod du byed pa yin te spyod pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir sgra nyid gcig par 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snga ma'am phyi ma'i blo bdag nyid snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba'i snod du byed pa yin te spyod pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir sgra nyid gcig par 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the prior or subsequent cognition is the basis for the experience of the prior or subsequent nature. It is not the case that the word itself is applied in the same way, because it is devoid of the aspect of experience.

original: de ni snga phyi nyams su myong ba las byung ba de dang de'i rnam pa rjes su bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la gang zhig snga phyi'i rnam par snang ba de de'i nges pa'i yul yang dag par 'byung bas mi slu ba skad cig ma la sogs
analyzed: de ni snga phyi nyams su myong ba las byung ba de dang de'i rnam pa rjes su bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la gang zhig snga phyi'i rnam par snang ba de de'i nges pa'i yul yang dag par 'byung bas mi slu ba skad cig ma la sogs
translated: That which arises from the experience of the prior and subsequent is the conceptual cognition that apprehends the aspects of those. When it appears as prior and subsequent, it is nondeceptive with regard to the ascertained object that arises from that.

original: pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin du de nyid ni rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag par byed do //
analyzed: pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin du de nyid ni rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo rnam par gzhag par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is like a conceptual cognition. That itself is what establishes the nature of cause and effect.

original: de bas na de'i rjes la rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rjes la rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be engaged in subsequently.

original: khyod la yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye pa'i khyad par las gzhan pa rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo'i sun 'byin pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod la yang rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa skye pa'i khyad par las gzhan pa rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo'i sun 'byin pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For you, there is no means of refuting the nature of cause and effect other than the arising of a particular aspect of conceptual cognition.

original: 'di tsam ni khyad par te 'gro ba la grags pa'i rim gyis nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba de'i phyir de mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam ni khyad par te 'gro ba la grags pa'i rim gyis nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba de'i phyir de mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: This much is the difference: it contradicts the experience of the world, which is familiar with gradualness. Therefore, it is not the result of direct perception.

analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: de lta na de kun rdzob pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na de kun rdzob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is conventional.

original: de nyid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de ltar khas len na rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bo med pa yang de nyid par mi 'gyur ro //

original: gcig nyid ma grub pa la yang //

original: gcig dang du ma nyid dag las rnam pa gzhan med pa dang / lhan cig tu dngos po nyid kyi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid dag las rnam pa gzhan med pa dang / lhan cig tu dngos po nyid kyi khyab pa ste /
translated: There is no other mode besides singularity and plurality, and the pervasion is that of the nature of things being mutually exclusive.

analyzed: de bas na khyab byed med pa la khyab bya yod pa nyid kyi yang dag par srid pa ga la 'gyur /

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: de gnod pa la mngon sum gyi gnod pa nyid dam bca' la'o //

analyzed: rang rig pa ni yod mod kyi //

original: rang rig pa ni yod mod kyi //

analyzed: de bas na ji ltar de dag gis dngos po'i khyab pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po yang cung zad pa ma yin te /

analyzed: gang gi gcig dang du ma dag gis dngos po dang khyab pa'o //

original: de la ni skyon te bsal ba tsam gyis kho bo cag la yod pa nyid de'i phyir de'i ngo bor gang yin gal te dngos po cung zang gcig dang du ma nyid @110b dag gis khyab pa nye bar dmigs pa de'i tshe chos thams cad rang bzhin medüîΩpa nyid la gnod pa'o //

original: gcig dang du ma nyid kyis dngos po la khyab pa gal te 'ga' zhig tu grub na de'i tshe thams cad stong pa nyid kyi dus su gtan tshigs ni 'dod pa rnam par 'joms par byed pa'o //

translated: If you establish that singularity and plurality pervade all things, then at the time of emptiness, the argument destroys what you maintain.

original: gzhan yang shes pa'i mi bden pa nyid 'di gang yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa'i mi bden pa nyid 'di gang yin /

original: gal te gnod par byed pa nyid yin na gnyis su med pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la nub pa'i yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis phan tshun du gnod pa zhes bya ba la yid ches gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa nyid yin na gnyis su med pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la nub pa'i yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis phan tshun du gnod pa zhes bya ba la yid ches gang yin zhe na /

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: gang du re zhig smras pa /

analyzed: gsal pa'i ngo bo yod pa nyid la gnod par nus par bya ba ma yin zhes de la yod pa nyid ni yod pa nyid do //

analyzed: gsal ba ni nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: yod pa nyid bden pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid la ni gnod pa la skyon gang yin /

analyzed: ldog pa tha dad pa med pa la sngon po la sogs pa ci'i phyir yod pa nyid ces yongs su 'dri ba la gang zhig smras pa /

analyzed: gsal ba las yod pa nyid ces de la gsal ba las gsal ba zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang zhig gsal ba las ni 'di'i yod 'dod pa ste //

analyzed: gal te ldog pa tha dad de yi yod ma yin //

analyzed: gang gis gsal bar byed pa de'i phyir gsal ba ste //

analyzed: ldog pa tha dad la ni de nyid gnod bya'o //

analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni mi bden ngo bo rig pa 'di ni don gang yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de gang zhig smra ba de yang gsal zin to //

analyzed: mi bden ngo bo rig pa 'di ni don gang yin //

analyzed: spyod pas stong pa rig pa zhes bya don gang zhig / gsal ba las 'di gnod pa yod pa ma yin te //

analyzed: de yi dgag pa dang ni grub pa ji ltar yin // zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gang zhig yang smras pa /

analyzed: ji ltar gcig dang du ma nyid dag gis dngos po la khyab pa sgrub pa zhes de la shin tu med @111a * //

analyzed: pa rnams dgag pa la thams cad du mtshan nyid du bsgrub pa ste /

analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir gcig dang du ma dag gis khyab pa sgrub pa ni bdag dang bdag med pa bzhin du'o //

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: bdag dang bcad pa dang bdag med pa dag las phung po gzhan yod pa ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: bdag 'jug pa dang rnam par gcod pa dag gis thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rtog ge'i bstan bcos nyid las rgyas par bshad pa zhes 'dir log par rtog pas chog go //

analyzed: de ltar khas mi len na thams cad rjes su dpag pa'i nges pas sgrub pa dor ba la gnyis su med pa la sogs pa sgrub pa yang ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa yod pa la yang dag par rig pa rnams la cung zad yod pa zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: sna tshogs nyid yod pa la rag lus par snang ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: @111b de lta na yang / nyer len nyid gcig de rnams kyis //

analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid sel lam ci // sna tshogs nyid kyis phan tshun du //

original: rang rig gcig la nub pa ste //
analyzed: rang rig gcig la nub pa ste //

analyzed: rnam pa rnams gnod pas mi bden pa nyid yin mod /
translated: The aspects are indeed false, since they are contradicted.

original: gsal ba tsam ni bden pa nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba tsam ni bden pa nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: But the mere manifestation is experienced as true.

original: de'i tshig nyid la 'khrul pa nyid mi rigs par mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshig nyid la 'khrul pa nyid mi rigs par mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is evident that it is not reasonable for the word itself to be false, since it is a direct perception.

original: gsal ba'i gsal ba nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste de'i 'khrul pa las nye bar 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i gsal ba nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste de'i 'khrul pa las nye bar 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The manifestation of the manifestation is the innate nature, and it is not approached through the falsity of that.

original: gang gis de'i rig pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de'i rig pa ni 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: By what is its cognition false?

original: sngon po ni ngo bo gzhan nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pas 'ongs par yang 'gyur zhes de'i rig pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po ni ngo bo gzhan nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pas 'ongs par yang 'gyur zhes de'i rig pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Since blue is a different nature, it is approached through falsity, and so its cognition is false.

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa la gnod byed 'jug pa yod de gsal ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa la gnod byed 'jug pa yod de gsal ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is an engagement of contradiction in blue, etc., but not in the manifestation.

original: lung thams cad la yang kun brtags dang mi bden pa dag nyid la 'gag pa rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: lung thams cad la yang kun brtags dang mi bden pa dag nyid la 'gag pa rtogs par bya ste /
translated: And in all scriptures, the imagined and the untrue are to be understood as blocked,

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba tsam la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba tsam la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not the mere manifestation.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here it should be said:

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams las tha dad pa gang yin /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams las tha dad pa gang yin /
translated: What is called ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù is different from blue, etc.

original: tha mi dad pa la gnod pa nyid kyis log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la gnod pa nyid kyis log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is refuted by the very fact that it is not different.

original: tha dad pa la ni tshad ma cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni tshad ma cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not the slightest valid cognition of difference.

original: re zhig mngon sum @112b ni ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum @112b ni ma yin la /
translated: First, it is not direct perception,

original: gsal bar gyur pa'i sngon po las gzhan nye bar dmigs pa yang dag par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa'i sngon po las gzhan nye bar dmigs pa yang dag par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehension of something different from manifest blue does not occur.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni sgrub par byed pa de rnams nyid las 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni sgrub par byed pa de rnams nyid las 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference is not accepted as a proof of that.

original: gal te sngon po rtogs pa'i ngo bo rtogs par gyur pa ni sngon po dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dag la rtogs pa ni med par mi nus pa zhes de'i phyir mi dmigs pa sgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po rtogs pa'i ngo bo rtogs par gyur pa ni sngon po dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid dag la rtogs pa ni med par mi nus pa zhes de'i phyir mi dmigs pa sgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the nature of the cognition of blue is not possible without the cognition of blue and the nature of the cognition, therefore non-apprehension is not a proof,

original: 'o na ba glang dkar zal 'gro ba rtogs par gyur pa la spyi dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa rtogs pas rgol bar gyur pa ji ltar bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ba glang dkar zal 'gro ba rtogs par gyur pa la spyi dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa rtogs pas rgol bar gyur pa ji ltar bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: But when one has the cognition of a white cow going, how can one avoid the objection that one has the cognition of a universal, a quality, an action, etc.?

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis tha mi dad par snang ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis tha mi dad par snang ba ste /
translated: It is through the power of ignorance that [the universal and the particular] appear as non-distinct.

original: 'di tsam gyis gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i srin po las yongs su skyob pa med do //üîΩma rig pa'am /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i srin po las yongs su skyob pa med do // ma rig pa'am /
translated: This much is enough to show that there is no protection from the demon of oneness and manyness.üîΩ[The opponent:] It is through the power of ignorance that one has the cognition of a universal and a particular as non-distinct.

original: ma rig pas ji srid du sngon po'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa'i gsal ba 'di sngon po'i bdag nyid kho na nyams su myong nas /
analyzed: ma rig pas ji srid du sngon po'i phyogs la khyab par byed pa'i gsal ba 'di sngon po'i bdag nyid kho na nyams su myong nas /
translated: As long as one has not experienced the manifestation that pervades the blue object as being of the nature of blue,

original: ji ltar 'gal ba'i chos yang dag pas bsre ba mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba'i chos yang dag pas bsre ba mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: one cannot possibly mix up the two, which are contradictory.

original: de yod pa la cha dang bcas pa la yan lag can bzhin du skyon no //
analyzed: de yod pa la cha dang bcas pa la yan lag can bzhin du skyon no //
translated: If it exists, there is the fault of having parts, like a whole.

original: cha dang bral ba la ni rdul phra rab bzhin du'o //
analyzed: cha dang bral ba la ni rdul phra rab bzhin du'o //
translated: If it is partless, it is like a subtle particle.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other possibility.

original: de bas na yod pa nyid sgrogs pa ni log pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na yod pa nyid sgrogs pa ni log pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the claim that it exists is false.

original: phyogs 'di la yang gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid mi zad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la yang gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan nyid mi zad pa kho na'o //
translated: In this regard, the definition of an image is simply non-exhaustion.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo dang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig pa nyams su myong nas /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo dang lhan cig tu bdag nyid gcig pa nyams su myong nas /
translated: Moreover, through the power of ignorance, one experiences the wheel of the aspects of blue, etc., as being of the same nature as the self.

original: snang bar gyur pa'i gsal ba'i rnam pa dang lhan cig tu mi bden pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis gzugs zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa zhes nges par gyur pa'i rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i gsal ba'i rnam pa dang lhan cig tu mi bden pa'i bdag nyid gcig pa nyid kyis gzugs zhes bya ba nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa zhes nges par gyur pa'i rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: Then, through the identity of the unreal with the aspect of the manifestation of the appearance, there is the disintegration of what is definitely known as form, etc., up to consciousness.

original: gzhan rnam pa thams cad du dri mas mtshan ma ma byas pa'i gsal ba tsam gyi skyes pa 'dod pa nyid ces rgyas pas nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa thams cad du dri mas mtshan ma ma byas pa'i gsal ba tsam gyi skyes pa 'dod pa nyid ces rgyas pas nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: But others do not accept that the mere manifestation, which is in no way defiled by the signs of the impurities, is the object of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: 'on te de ltar yin na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa ni gzugs brnyan zhes 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar yin na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa ni gzugs brnyan zhes 'gyur ram /
translated: But if that is so, is the domain of the yogi's practice an image?

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: That also is stated by the Lord.

original: gnas pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi zhes khyod la shin tu grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas pa ni sangs rgyas pa rnam pa bzhi zhes khyod la shin tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: And the abiding is the fourfold Buddhahood, which is well known to you.

original: bstan pa'i dus su yang yod pa ma yin pa zhes ji ltar gsungs /
analyzed: bstan pa'i dus su yang yod pa ma yin pa zhes ji ltar gsungs /
translated: And at the time of teaching, how is it said that it does not exist?

original: gzugs brnyan @113a * //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan @113a * //
translated: It is like a reflection.

original: skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: It is said that it arises.

original: bden te lung las rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa la yang yod de /
analyzed: bden te lung las rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa la yang yod de /
translated: It is true that it is also in the Yogacara stage in the scriptures.

original: 'on kyang 'di lta bu ni log pa'i grub mtha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di lta bu ni log pa'i grub mtha' ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not a false philosophy.

original: de la ni gzhan dbang bstan pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni gzhan dbang bstan pa rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: In that, the teaching of the dependent is the Yogacara stage.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni dbu ma'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa ni dbu ma'o //
translated: The teaching of the perfected nature is the Madhyamaka.

original: ji srid du log par snang ba khams gsum ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa la mi 'jug pa de srid du chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la 'jug par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du log par snang ba khams gsum ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa la mi 'jug pa de srid du chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la 'jug par mi nus pa'o //
translated: As long as the false appearance of the three realms is not entered into as mere representation, the entry into the emptiness of all phenomena is not possible.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa ni lam mo //
translated: Therefore, the Yogacara stage is the path.

original: 'bras bu ni dbu ma'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dbu ma'o //
translated: The result is the Madhyamaka.

original: de ltar na yang 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'phags pa la dkar gshegs pa las /
translated: it says:

original: sems tsam la ni zhon nas su //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni zhon nas su //
translated: Having mounted on mind only,

original: phyi rol du ni 'da' bar bya //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'da' bar bya //
translated: one should transcend external things.

original: de bzhin nyid dmigs la gnas nas //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dmigs la gnas nas //
translated: Abiding in the observation of suchness,

original: sems tsam las kyang rnam par 'da' //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems tsam las kyang rnam par 'da' // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one should transcend mind only.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: And the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa bzlog don du //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa bzlog don du //
translated: In order to stop the conception of a self,

original: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
analyzed: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
translated: the aggregates, constituents, and so on are taught.

original: sems tsam rnam par gzhag pas ni //üîΩde yang skal chen rnams kyis 'jig /'di ni thams cad sems tsam zhes //
analyzed: sems tsam rnam par gzhag pas ni // de yang skal chen rnams kyis 'jig /'di ni thams cad sems tsam zhes //
translated: By positing mind only,üîΩeven that is destroyed by the wise.üîΩThis teaching that everything is mind only

original: bstan pa gang zhig thub pa yi //
analyzed: bstan pa gang zhig thub pa yi //
translated: was given by the Sage

original: skrag pa yongs su spang phyir te //
analyzed: skrag pa yongs su spang phyir te //
translated: in order to eliminate fear.

original: byis pa rnams la de nyid min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la de nyid min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not reality for the childish.

original: de ltar na don gyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid 'di zhes rtogs shing rnam par rig pa la mi bden pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don gyis stong pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam nyid 'di zhes rtogs shing rnam par rig pa la mi bden pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one should understand that this mere representation, which is empty of an object, is not the understanding of the unreality of representation.

original: gzhan du ni shes pa'i brdzun pa nyid med de don med par yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni shes pa'i brdzun pa nyid med de don med par yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, consciousness would not be false, because it would arise without an object.

original: de bas na gzhan dbang la yang 'khrul ba tsam gyi lus kyis shes bzhin du kun brtags med pa rnam par sgom pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa dor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dbang la yang 'khrul ba tsam gyi lus kyis shes bzhin du kun brtags med pa rnam par sgom pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid la 'jug pa dor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not abandon the entry into emptiness through the cultivation of the imagined nature as nonexistent by means of the body which is merely an error in the relative.

original: de bas na dang por khams gsum po ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes sgom par byed pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i gnas skabs la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dang por khams gsum po ni rnam par rig pa tsam zhes sgom par byed pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i gnas skabs la rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the first stage of the bodhisattva is the meditative cultivation of the three realms as perception-only. This is the stage of the bodhisattva who is in the state of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa /
translated: This is why the Madhyantavibhaga says:

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rag / so sor snang ba skye ba med //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rag / so sor snang ba skye ba med //
translated: The non-production of the appearance of objects, sentient beings, and the self,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di don med //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di don med //
translated: is the non-existence of objects for consciousness.

original: de med phyir yang de yang med //
analyzed: de med phyir yang de yang med //
translated: Since that does not exist, this also does not exist.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog nyid //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog nyid //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: 'di la de bas grub pa yin //
analyzed: 'di la de bas grub pa yin //
translated: is established as existing in this way.

original: kun @113b tu med phyir de lta min //
analyzed: kun @113b tu med phyir de lta min //
translated: It is not so in the case of the complete non-existence of that.

original: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod //
translated: And through their exhaustion, one is liberated.üîΩ

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is exhausted, one is liberated.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni gang gi phyir snang ba ji ltar skye ba yin pa de ltar 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni gang gi phyir snang ba ji ltar skye ba yin pa de ltar 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: Since appearances arise in this way, they do not exist in this way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin te 'khrul pa tsam skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin te 'khrul pa tsam skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not nonexistent in every way, because a mere error arises.

original: slar yang 'di'i med pa nyid ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: slar yang 'di'i med pa nyid ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Again, why is their nonexistence not accepted?

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩde zad pa na grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / de zad pa na grol bar 'dod //
translated: Because

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: since it is exhausted, one is liberated.

original: 'di rnams ni rnal 'byor spyod par 'dod pa rnam par rig pa nyid don dam par 'dod pa rnam pa de la gzud pas stong pa nyid skad cig ma la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis nye bar brtags pa'i dbye ba can /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rnal 'byor spyod par 'dod pa rnam par rig pa nyid don dam par 'dod pa rnam pa de la gzud pas stong pa nyid skad cig ma la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa tsam gyis nye bar brtags pa'i dbye ba can /
translated: These are the assertions of the YogƒÅcƒÅra who assert that consciousness is ultimate. Since they are introduced to that, they are like momentary emptiness and so on. They are imputed by mere conceptuality.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa zhes don dam par yod pa'i stong pa nyid tha snyad du yod pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa dang gzhan dbang don dam par yod par smra ba rnams bstan pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid yin
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa zhes don dam par yod pa'i stong pa nyid tha snyad du yod pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa dang gzhan dbang don dam par yod par smra ba rnams bstan pa las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid yin
translated: The essence of consciousness is the ultimate, and the emptiness of ultimate existence is conventional existence, superficial existence, and the ultimate existence of the relative.

original: no // de bas na de'i 'dod pa gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: no // de bas na de'i 'dod pa gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba bstan pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the assertion of those who are outside the teaching that the reflection arises should be understood.

original: gang zhig yang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i stobs kyis mi bden pa nyid rtogs nas yang gzhan dbang la //
analyzed: gang zhig yang gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i stobs kyis mi bden pa nyid rtogs nas yang gzhan dbang la //
translated: Someone else, having understood unreality by the power of the absence of one and many, does not assert the relative to be

original: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod //üîΩces bya bar mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod // ces bya bar mi 'dod de /
translated: liberated by its extinction.

original: 'on kyang sgyur ma lta bu nyid dang dpyad pa mi bzod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can zhes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa stong pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa dang chos kyi sku
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyur ma lta bu nyid dang dpyad pa mi bzod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can zhes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa stong pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa dang chos kyi sku
translated: But the nature of consciousness is the emptiness of the essence that is perceived, which is the direct realization of emptiness, the nature of consciousness itself, and the Dharma Body.

original: thob pa zhes smra ba de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i dus nyid la 'khrul ba ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni cher bzang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa zhes smra ba de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i dus nyid la 'khrul ba ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni cher bzang ba ma yin no //
translated: For those who speak of attainment, it is not at all good to say that the pacification of error occurs at the very time of realizing the dharmakƒÅya of the Bhagavat.

original: kho bo cag la ni mi bden par snang ba la 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni mi bden par snang ba la 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: For us, there is no error in the appearance of the unreal.

original: 'on kyang de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: But it is the apprehension of what is not that as that.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba rnams la mtshan nyid 'dir rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba rnams la mtshan nyid 'dir rigs pa yin te /
translated: This definition is correct for those who speak of consciousness with aspects.

original: dbu ma la ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbu ma la ni ma yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: But not for the MƒÅdhyamikas.

original: brdzun pa mi bden pa med par gyur pa gsal ba ste gsal ba ni 'khrul pa ma yin zhes ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: brdzun pa mi bden pa med par gyur pa gsal ba ste gsal ba ni 'khrul pa ma yin zhes ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: For how could the unreal, the false, the nonexistent, the manifest be manifest and not error?

original: rab rib can la skra med kyang skra'i snang ba ni 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la skra med kyang skra'i snang ba ni 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of hair for one with an eye disease is not without error.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi skra la zhen pa zhes bka' dang 'jig rten pa la yang 'khrul pa'i tha snyad @114a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi skra la zhen pa zhes bka' dang 'jig rten pa la yang 'khrul pa'i tha snyad @114a * //
translated: But it is called the adherence to external hair. In the scriptures and in the world, the term error is used

original: do // de ltar na gsal ba'i ngo bos rnam par shes pa don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: do // de ltar na gsal ba'i ngo bos rnam par shes pa don dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, consciousness is called ultimate because of its nature as clarity.

original: dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi don ni yul zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi don ni yul zhes bya bas so //
translated: The object of the highest supramundane wisdom is called the ultimate.

original: de bas na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba nyid 'di bdag nyid dbu ma pa zhes don med par sgrogs par byed de /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes par smra ba nyid 'di bdag nyid dbu ma pa zhes don med par sgrogs par byed de /
translated: Therefore, this doctrine of consciousness with aspects is a mere boast on the part of those who proclaim themselves to be MƒÅdhyamikas.

analyzed: sman ni bro 'tshal bas nye bar longs sbyad par bya'o //

analyzed: yo byad ni ji ltar rigs pa'o //

original: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i 'bras bu rgya che bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma'i 'bras bu rgya che bas so //
translated: The great result is the extensive result in the future.

original: sman yon chan por zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid du lha'i srung ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sman yon chan por zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid du lha'i srung ba la sogs pa 'bras bu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great reward is the attainment of the result in this life, such as divine protection, etc.

original: gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa /

analyzed: 'thad pa gang zhig de la brgya byin rang nyid kyis brjod nas nye bar sdud cing smras pa ni //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa shin tu myur ba'i phyir /

original: bsod nams ches mang du skyed do zhes bya ba'o //
