original: tshig gcig gis phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis phun sum tshogs pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: One verse on the perfection of the two purities.üîΩNow, two verses on relinquishment:üîΩUncontaminated,

original: da ni tshig gnyis kyis spangs pa gsungs pa ni nye bar gos pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gnyis kyis spangs pa gsungs pa ni nye bar gos pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and unstained by any worldly thing.

original: sgrib pa dang dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang dri ma thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Uncontaminated means that all obscurations and stains are exhausted.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis nye bar mi gos pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dri ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis nye bar mi gos pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi dri ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unstained by any worldly thing means that the stains of the three realms are exhausted.

original: da ni tshig gsum gyis ye shes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni tshig gsum gyis ye shes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, three verses on intuition:

original: snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Illuminating,üîΩand dispelling the darkness for all beings.

original: snang ba ni chos thams cad la don dam par snang ba ste de byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni chos thams cad la don dam par snang ba ste de byed pa'o //
translated: Illuminating means that it illuminates all things in the ultimate.üîΩHere, two verses on the two causes:üîΩRemoving the cataracts of all beings in the three realms,üîΩand bestowing the eye of Dharma.

original: 'dir tshig gnyis kyis rgyu gnyis su gsungs pa ni khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste rab rib ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshig gnyis kyis rgyu gnyis su gsungs pa ni khams gsum pa thams cad kyi rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste rab rib ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Cataracts are ignorance.

original: de bzlog pa ni rab rib dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzlog pa ni rab rib dang bral ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The removal of that is the intuition free from cataracts.

original: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: khams gsum ni khams gsum gyi don dam pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum ni khams gsum gyi don dam pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the ultimate of the three realms.

original: de la rab rib dang bral ba de byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab rib dang bral ba de byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la khyab pa'o //
translated: The one who is free from cataracts is the agent, this is the pervasion with respect to the object.üîΩThe one who removes all the darkness of the afflictions and views is the one who removes all the darkness of the afflictions and views.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa thams cad sel ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i mun pa thams cad sel ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'o //
translated: The afflictions and views are the afflictions and views.

original: de rnams nyid ni mun pa ste thams cad kyang yin la de rnams kyang yin te /
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni mun pa ste thams cad kyang yin la de rnams kyang yin te /
translated: They are all the darkness, and they are those.

original: de rnams la sel bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa thams cad zad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la sel bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa thams cad zad pa'o //
translated: The one who removes them is the one who removes all the darkness of the afflictions and views.

original: 'di tsam thams cad kyis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di tsam thams cad kyis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: All of this much is the statement of the perfection of one's own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /üîΩbrten par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste @132a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni / brten par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste @132a * //
translated: With regard to the perfection of others' aims, it is stated:

original: go 'phang thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: go 'phang thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The one who causes the attainment of all the stages by those who desire them.üîΩThe one who causes the attainment of all the stages by those who desire them.

original: mchog tu bgyid pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog tu bgyid pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one who causes the attainment of the supreme by those who desire it.

original: mchog ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The supreme is nirvana with remainder.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyi 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it is the result of the factors of enlightenment.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bde ba ste de bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bde ba ste de bgyid pa'o //
translated: Nirvana without remainder is happiness, and it is produced by that.

original: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa ni bde ba ste de bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa ni bde ba ste de bgyid pa'o //
translated: Or, the supramundane is happiness, and it is produced by that.

original: sems can ltongs pa rnams la snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes med pa de srid du ldongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ltongs pa rnams la snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes med pa de srid du ldongs pa'o //
translated: It is the illumination for sentient beings in darkness, meaning that as long as there is no supramundane wisdom, there is darkness.

original: de rnams la de bskyed pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la de bskyed pa'i phyir snang bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: For them, it produces that, so it is illumination.

original: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spang ba dang snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad spangs pa'i snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste de bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad rab tu spang ba dang snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad spangs pa'i snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ste de bgyid pa'o //
translated: It is the illumination that completely abandons all fears and harms, meaning the illumination that completely abandons all fears and harms is the supramundane path of meditation, and it is produced by that.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni theg pa dman pa gnas pa rnams la don gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni theg pa dman pa gnas pa rnams la don gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This much is the meaning for those who abide in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni spyan lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni spyan lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning for the bodhisattvas is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe five eyes.‚Äù

original: de rnams ni gzhan don gyi gtso bo rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni gzhan don gyi gtso bo rnams so //
translated: These are the chief means for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan don la yang de nyid sgrub byed de dmigs pa'i dbye bas sha dang lha dang shes rab dang sangs rgyas dang chos mi zad pa'i spyan gyi 'khor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don la yang de nyid sgrub byed de dmigs pa'i dbye bas sha dang lha dang shes rab dang sangs rgyas dang chos mi zad pa'i spyan gyi 'khor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: And for the benefit of others, it is the very same thing that is the means, endowed with the retinue of the five eyes, which are the eyes of flesh, of gods, of wisdom, of the Dharma, and of the Buddha, distinguished by their objects.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mig lags so zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pas de nyid ni mig ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mig lags so zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pas de nyid ni mig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the eye‚Äù means that it is the very same thing as the eye, because it is not different.

original: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is the eye because it sees the ultimate of all phenomena.

original: / gti mug dang mun pa dang rab rib rnams dang bral bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba la gti mug nyid ni mun pa dang rab rib ste /
analyzed: / gti mug dang mun pa dang rab rib rnams dang bral bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba la gti mug nyid ni mun pa dang rab rib ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the remover of delusion, darkness, and blindness‚Äù means that delusion itself is darkness and blindness.

original: mthar thug pa'i mun pa ste ji lta ba bzhin gyi don mthong ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mun pa ste ji lta ba bzhin gyi don mthong ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ultimate darkness, the obstruction to seeing the meaning as it is.

original: de la rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa ni rnam par 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa ni rnam par 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the one that removes the cataracts is the one that destroys.

original: rab rib ni lta ba'i skyon te de dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib ni lta ba'i skyon te de dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir rab rib dang bral bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: Cataracts are the fault of vision; because it removes that, it removes the cataracts.

original: de lta bur gyur ba 'byung zhing ci zhig skyed par byed ces gsungs pa ni chos thams cad mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba 'byung zhing ci zhig skyed par byed ces gsungs pa ni chos thams cad mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What kind of one arises and what does it generate? It is said, ‚Äúall phenomena are inactive.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: All phenomena are the five aggregates.

original: de rnams @132b la yang ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: de rnams @132b la yang ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
translated: And they have three natures:

original: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la kun brtags ni byed pa ma yin te mtshan nyid ji lta bar de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun brtags ni byed pa ma yin te mtshan nyid ji lta bar de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the imagined is not an agent, because it does not exist as it is imagined.

original: gzhan dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The dependent is the unreal imagination.

original: de ni byed pa ma yin te de'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byed pa ma yin te de'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not the agent, because it is the antidote to that.

original: yongs su grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings te de yang mi byed de thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings te de yang mi byed de thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfected is the dharma-element, and that also is not the agent, because it is without beginning or end.

original: gal te yang dag pa'i ye shes byed ce na mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yang ye shes thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid de de la yang 'khrul pa log pa tsam nyid kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i ye shes byed ce na mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yang ye shes thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid de de la yang 'khrul pa log pa tsam nyid kyis thob pa'o //
translated: If it is said that right knowledge is the agent, it is the object of the equality of equality, and the state of the nature of the object and the agent is the knowledge without beginning or end. And in that, it is attained by the mere reversal of error.üîΩWhat is it that is done?

original: 'o na ci zhig byed ce na gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig byed ce na gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: lam log par mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam log par mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe path of those who have gone astray, etc.‚Äù

original: lam log pa ni chos rnams la yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lam log pa ni chos rnams la yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: The path of those who have gone astray is the thorough investigation of phenomena.

original: des mchis pa rnams la lam du ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: des mchis pa rnams la lam du ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Those who have gone astray by that path are led to the path of the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang gi lam la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi lam la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The path of which is the path of omniscience.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su sgrub pa zhes gang zhig gsungs pa de'i gzhan don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su sgrub pa zhes gang zhig gsungs pa de'i gzhan don gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is the attainment of the knowledge of a knower of all things.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The benefit for others is stated in the line beginning ‚Äúthe knowledge of all things.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa de la de'i tshe 'di thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa de la de'i tshe 'di thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one abandons the connection with the instincts, then one has the knowledge of all things.üîΩNow, if the perfection of wisdom itself does not produce or stop the production or stopping of anything, then why is it said that it produces all the qualities of a Buddha?

original: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni skyed par byed pa dang 'gag par byed pa skye ba dang 'gag pa ste ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni mi skyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩchos thams cad la mi skyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni skyed par byed pa dang 'gag par byed pa skye ba dang 'gag pa ste ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni mi skyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / chos thams cad la mi skyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The line beginning ‚Äúit does not produce‚Äù answers this.üîΩThe non-production of all things is the aspect of purification.

original: chos thams cad mi 'gog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'gog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi'o //
translated: The non-stopping of all things is the aspect of addiction.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi don dam pa ni rang nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi don dam pa ni rang nyid kyi chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúunborn and unceasing‚Äù means that the ultimate reality of all phenomena is their own intrinsic realm of reality.

original: des na 'di rnams la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir byis pa rnams la snang ba'i ngo bos shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid med do //
analyzed: des na 'di rnams la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir byis pa rnams la snang ba'i ngo bos shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams la skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, since they are without beginning and end, they are utterly nonexistent in the nature that appears to the childish. Thus, they are neither born nor do they cease.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrten cing @133a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba'o // rten cing @133a * //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of their own marks.‚Äù

original: 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan dbang slar 'di rnams la ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba gzhan dbang slar 'di rnams la ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni yum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dependent origination of the other-dependent is taught here in terms of its intrinsic reality.

original: yum ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yum ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The mother is the one who gives birth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po che thams cad stsol ba'i slad du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po che thams cad stsol ba'i slad du ste /
translated: Because she bestows all the jewels of the Buddha‚Äôs teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni rin po che ste de rnams ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni rin po che ste de rnams ster bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All the qualities of a Buddha are jewels, because they bestow those.

original: de rnams thams cad rgyu'i gnas skabs su gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus so //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad rgyu'i gnas skabs su gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus so //
translated: The bodies of the Bodhisattvas, who are the cause of those, are the mine of those.

original: de bas na 'di de'i tshe na de rnams la skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di de'i tshe na de rnams la skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, at that time, he generates those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos skyed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas skyed par byed pa nyid kyi don las go ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos skyed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas skyed par byed pa nyid kyi don las go ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúBuddha-generator‚Äù is understood from the meaning of ‚Äúgenerator of the qualities of a Buddha.‚Äù

original: de tsam gyis ni sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par go ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par go ba ma yin no //
translated: But the Buddhas are not understood to be distinguished by that alone.

original: de bas na yon tan can gyi khyad par rnams kyis slar de gsungs pa ni stobs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan can gyi khyad par rnams kyis slar de gsungs pa ni stobs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Therefore, he again mentions the distinction of their qualities, with ‚Äúthe ten powers,‚Äù etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams ni bcu ste de rnams bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams ni bcu ste de rnams bgyid pa'o //
translated: The powers of the TathƒÅgatas are ten, and he generates those.

original: bcu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / lhag par mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / lhag par mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing the various faculties,üîΩthe power of knowing all the paths that lead everywhere,üîΩthe power of knowing all the meditative absorptions, liberations, samƒÅdhis, and samƒÅpattis, as well as their afflictive and purified aspects,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ldang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ldang ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing one‚Äôs former abodes,üîΩthe power of knowing deaths and transmigrations,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag ni srid pa dang mi srid pa dag gam yang dag par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par mi 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag ni srid pa dang mi srid pa dag gam yang dag par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par mi 'byung ba dag go //
translated: The possible and the impossible are the possible and the impossible, or the correct and the incorrect.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa ni gnas te 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the undesirable karmic maturation of misconduct is possible, but the desirable is impossible.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa dag ni las dang rnam par @133b smin pa'o //
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa dag ni las dang rnam par @133b smin pa'o //

analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni dngos po ston par byed pa'i sgra'o //

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i de'i nges pa'i shes pa dang de sngon du 'gro ba can ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i de'i nges pa'i shes pa dang de sngon du 'gro ba can ni tha snyad do //
translated: Formation is the subsequent ascertainment of that, and the convention that precedes it.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'on ji ltar gtod par bgyid ces bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par bgyid ces bya ba kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir ji ltar gtod par byed ces 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'on ji ltar gtod par bgyid ces bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtod par bgyid ces bya ba kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir ji ltar gtod par byed ces 'dri ba yin no //
translated: But how, O Lord, is it directed? The perfection of wisdom is directed to the knowledge of all modes.  How is it directed? is asked, because of the conventional existence.

original: ji ltar gtod par mi byed pa de ltar gtod par byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bos gnas pa yin zhes de'i phyir thams cad mkhyenüîΩpa nyid la gtod par byed ces brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gtod par mi byed pa de ltar gtod par byed do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bos gnas pa yin zhes de'i phyir thams cad mkhyenüîΩpa nyid la gtod par byed ces brjod pa yin la /
translated: It is directed in such a way that it is not directed.  In such a way that it is not directed, in that way it is directed means that at the stage of non-discrimination, the perfection of wisdom itself abides in the nature of the knowledge of all modes. Therefore, it is said that it is directed to the knowledge of all modes.

original: chos gang la yang gtod par mi byed ces kyang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gang la yang gtod par mi byed ces kyang brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is also said that one should not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji srid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji srid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so.

original: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni de'i gnas skabs la med pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba ma yin la 'gag pa yang ma yin pa des na gnas skabs @137b de skye ba med pa'i phyir dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir so sor gnasüîΩpa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni de'i gnas skabs la med pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba ma yin la 'gag pa yang ma yin pa des na gnas skabs @137b de skye ba med pa'i phyir dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir so sor gnas pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is amazing‚Äù means that since all dharmas do not exist in that state, they are not produced and also not ceased. Therefore, since that state is not produced and not ceased, it is said to be ‚Äúabiding individually.‚Äù

original: nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar mi gnas pa dag gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni gnas pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar mi gnas pa dag gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni gnas pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since both abiding and non-abiding are conceptualizations, it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not abide.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar mi gnas pa dag dngos po'i yan lag tu gyur pa gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa dang nye bar mi gnas pa dag dngos po'i yan lag tu gyur pa gnyi ga la yang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is like that‚Äù means that since both abiding and non-abiding are conceptualizations in terms of being and not being a part of an entity, it is in terms of their nature.

original: 'du shes par bgyid ring du bgyid na zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: 'du shes par bgyid ring du bgyid na zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bos so //
translated: The phrase one makes it into a perception, one makes it last refers to its nature.

original: gsog tu bgyid ces bya ba ni yang dag par phyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsog tu bgyid ces bya ba ni yang dag par phyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one makes it into a heap refers to the fact that it is not really collected.

original: gsob tu bgyid ces byas ba ni yang dag par phyogs par gyur pa'i ye shes la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsob tu bgyid ces byas ba ni yang dag par phyogs par gyur pa'i ye shes la de'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one makes it into a void refers to the fact that the wisdom which is really collected does not have that as its characteristic.

original: mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The phrase one does not make it refers to the fact that it does not arise as a result of that.

original: rnam grangs 'di ni yod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyod kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'di ni yod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyod kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is the case refers to the fact that it is as you have stated.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ring du byed pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ring du byed pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: The phrase that refers to the fact that one makes it last, etc.

original: yongs su gsal bar byas pa ni rtogs par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar byas pa ni rtogs par bya ba la'o //
translated: The phrase one makes it clear refers to the fact that it is to be understood.

original: ji srid du gzugs nas sangs rgyas nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid du gzugs nas sangs rgyas nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase as long as one does not make it into form, etc., up to: one does not make it into the knowledge of all modes refers to the fact that it is not the knowledge of all modes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi nang nas chos 'ga' zhig kyang med de gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi nang nas chos 'ga' zhig kyang med de gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever among all dharmas, such as form, because forms, etc. are the nature of realization, the very essence of realization. The meaning is: in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na chos gang la yang ring du bgyid pa ma yin 'di mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos gang la yang ring du bgyid pa ma yin 'di mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one does not make any dharma distant, nor does one make it non-existent.

original: rnam grangs gang gis zhes gnas brtan la dris pa la rang gi 'dod pa pha rol tu phyin pa chen po nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa ni gzugs chen por mi bgyid chung dur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos kyi gzugs chen por
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis zhes gnas brtan la dris pa la rang gi 'dod pa pha rol tu phyin pa chen po nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa ni gzugs chen por mi bgyid chung dur mi bgyid ces bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos kyi gzugs chen por
translated: As for the question to the elder about by what enumeration, his own assertion is clarified by the greatness of the perfections. Not making form great, not making it small means not making the perfect, dharmic form great.

original: bgyid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bgyid pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not make it small.

original: kun brtags kyi gzugs chung ngur mi bgyid ces bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gzugs chung ngur mi bgyid ces bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Not making imagined form small should be applied to all.

original: sdud par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas so //
analyzed: sdud par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not contract‚Äù means do not attain nirvana.

original: g-yengs par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci log pas so //üîΩgal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @138a * //
analyzed: g-yengs par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci log pas so // gal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @138a * //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not scatter‚Äù means do not err.

original: pa gzugs che bar mi bgyid chung bar mi phyir ces bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: pa gzugs che bar mi bgyid chung bar mi phyir ces bya ba yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is so‚Äù means if the perfection of wisdom is not even slightly existent, then it is reasonable to say that it does not contract or expand.

original: don ni 'di yin te gal te pha rol tu phyin pa ni cung zad phyir na de ltar yod pa na 'di ni mi phyir ces bya ba 'di brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gal te pha rol tu phyin pa ni cung zad phyir na de ltar yod pa na 'di ni mi phyir ces bya ba 'di brjod par rigs te /
translated: The meaning is this: if the perfection is not even slightly existent, then it is reasonable to say that it does not contract or expand.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun rtags thams cad las 'das pa de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs che bar mi phyir chung bar mi phyir ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun rtags thams cad las 'das pa de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs che bar mi phyir chung bar mi phyir ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since the perfection of wisdom transcends all conceptual fictions, it is not reasonable to say that the perfection does not contract or expand, does not increase or decrease, etc.

original: lta smos su ci mchis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don la'o //
analyzed: lta smos su ci mchis zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhat to say‚Äù has the sense of a distinction.

original: de ltar zhes brjod nas de nyid gsungs pa ni bdag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ste 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes brjod nas de nyid gsungs pa ni bdag ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ste 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Having said in that way, he states that very thing: I am endowed with the wisdom of omniscience, in this way, etc.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la de ltar 'tshal na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung mi 'don bzhin du /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la de ltar 'tshal na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung mi 'don bzhin du /
translated: In the old editions, the text does not recite in that way, I would be a knower of all aspects, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags te zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa ma lags te zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
translated: This is not the concordant result of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma'i rgyu mthun pa de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu gang zhig sems can du dmigs pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma'i rgyu mthun pa de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu gang zhig sems can du dmigs pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: That concordant result of the Bhagavatƒ´, which has the characteristic of not observing any phenomena, is any result that is related to the observation of sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can rnams dang de rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe 'di nyid ni nye bar dmigs pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams dang de rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mthong bar gyur na de'i tshe 'di nyid ni nye bar dmigs pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one sees sentient beings and their defilement and purification, then this is called the great observation.

original: de ltar na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du 'di thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par rtsom pa de yang mtshan mar sgro 'dogs par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du 'di thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par rtsom pa de yang mtshan mar sgro 'dogs par byed cing /
translated: Thus, for the sake of completely liberating all sentient beings, the bodhisattva undertakes all of this, and yet he does not reify it as a sign.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa med par chos gzhan la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa med par chos gzhan la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: How much less would he do so with regard to other dharmas, without the practice of the perfections?üîΩSince this is the very meaning of the S≈´tra, how much less would he do so with regard to the meaning of the S≈´tra, which is perfectly connected?

original: dgongs pa'i don 'di nyid kyis mdo'i don dang yang dag par 'brel ba'i phyir lta smos kyang ci mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ste kho bo cag gis yongs su dor ba zhes bya ba ni slob dpon skyong ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i don 'di nyid kyis mdo'i don dang yang dag par 'brel ba'i phyir lta smos kyang ci mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ste kho bo cag gis yongs su dor ba zhes bya ba ni slob dpon skyong ba'o //
translated: The master P≈´r·πáavardhana says that ‚Äúwe have abandoned‚Äù means ‚Äúwe have rejected.‚Äù

original: da ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba dogs nas /
analyzed: da ni de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba dogs nas /
translated: Now, in order to remove the doubt, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: sems can ji lta ba de ltar shes @138b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes rnam grangs mang pos ston par byed pa ni sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sems can ji lta ba de ltar shes @138b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes rnam grangs mang pos ston par byed pa ni sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The teaching that the perfection of wisdom is like sentient beings is shown by the many synonyms beginning with ‚Äúsentient beings are essenceless.‚Äù

original: sems can bzhin du ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i rigs can te ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems can bzhin du ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i rigs can te ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are of the class of essencelessness like sentient beings. Essence is characteristic.

original: rigs ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni skye ba'o //
translated: Class is origination.

original: de dag dang bral ba nyid ni 'dir rgyu ste sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral ba nyid ni 'dir rgyu ste sems can ngo bo nyid ma mchis pas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The absence of those is the cause here. Since sentient beings are essenceless,

analyzed: dben pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pas skyon rnams kyis ma gos pa'o //
translated: they are isolated. Since they are essenceless, they are unstained by faults.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pas na zhes bya ba ni bsam pas mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pas na zhes bya ba ni bsam pas mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are inconceivable, they are not perceived by thought.

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i chos nyid ni dngos po las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of fearlessness is essencelessness from things.

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ni so sor rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-complete-perfect buddhahood is the absence of discrimination.

original: yang dag pa'i don ni yang dag par gyur pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni yang dag par gyur pa'i don no //

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba ni mi 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: sems can ni de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pa'o //

original: ji ltar sems can stobs yang dag par sgrub pa nyid ni nyam chung ba nyid dam shes rab kyi stobs med pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la stobs yang dag par ma grub pa nyid do //

translated: Thus, the elder Shariputra, who has increased his faith in this perfection of wisdom through its greatness and its vastness, asks the bodhisattva about two things:

original: de rnams bsrung ba'i don du dang tshul 'di la yongs pas na de yun ring po ji srid cig tu dpyad cing tshul bsrungs pa ste rkyen ni ni ni'o //
analyzed: de rnams bsrung ba'i don du dang tshul 'di la yongs pas na de yun ring po ji srid cig tu dpyad cing tshul bsrungs pa ste rkyen ni ni ni'o //
translated: Delusion

original: don dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pas so ;
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pas so ;
translated: The meaning is the accomplishment of the characteristic of emptiness.

original: / don gyi tshul zhes bya ba'i de nyid la rigs pas so //
analyzed: / don gyi tshul zhes bya ba'i de nyid la rigs pas so //
translated: The method of the meaning is by means of reasoning in that reality.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos la gom pas so //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos la gom pas so //
translated: The reality is by means of the Dharma that is taught.

original: chos nyid tshul zhes bya ba ni de nyid la mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid tshul zhes bya ba ni de nyid la mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The method of reality is by means of the method of the brief teaching and the extensive explanation, etc. in that reality.

original: rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su tshol bas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su tshol bas so //
translated: The concomitant is by means of the investigation.

original: rjes su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba ni de ltar shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba ni de ltar shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The understanding is by means of the knowledge of that.

original: rjes su rtogs par bgyid pa ni gzhan dag rnams la'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs par bgyid pa ni gzhan dag rnams la'o //
translated: The realization is for others.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rtags gang las so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rtags gang las so //
translated: Why is that? is the reason.

original: gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtags gsungs so ;
analyzed: gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtags gsungs so ;
translated: The reason is stated by someone, etc.

original: / bdag gis ston pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: / bdag gis ston pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mthong ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the teacher is the seeing by me.

original: 'brel pa can brjod par 'dod pas drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can brjod par 'dod pas drug pa'o //
translated: The genitive case is for the purpose of expressing the one who is related to the desire to speak.

original: rna ba blags nas zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa dang bcas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba blags nas zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa dang bcas par byed pa'o //
translated: With ears attentive means with one-pointedness.

original: gus par zhes bya ba ni gus pas sam 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gus par zhes bya ba ni gus pas sam 'dod pas so //
translated: With respect means with devotion or desire.

original: gtam gyi bar chad mi byed ces bya ba ni rnam par chad pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtam gyi bar chad mi byed ces bya ba ni rnam par chad pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not interrupting the conversation means not breaking it off.

original: yun ring por spyad cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring por spyad cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Having practiced for a long time is a summary.

original: sangs rgyas mang po rnams la gang gi bsnyen bkur byas pa de ni de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po rnams la gang gi bsnyen bkur byas pa de ni de skad du brjod do //
translated: Having served many Buddhas is what is being asked about.

original: mnyan nus sam zhes bya ba ni ci zhig la dri ba'o /
analyzed: mnyan nus sam zhes bya ba ni ci zhig la dri ba'o /
translated: Are you able to listen? is what is being asked.

original: @139b mnyan pa ni sgras so //
analyzed: @139b mnyan pa ni sgras so //
translated: Listening is by means of sound.

original: rtogs pa ni don las so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni don las so //
translated: Understanding is by means of the meaning.

original: bsam pa ni dus gzhan la dran pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dus gzhan la dran pa'i don du'o //
translated: Thinking is for the sake of remembering at another time.

original: bskyed pa ni bsam pa'i dus la'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni bsam pa'i dus la'o //
translated: Generating is at the time of thinking.

original: nye bar gzung ba ni bsgom pa'i dus la sems la brtan par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gzung ba ni bsgom pa'i dus la sems la brtan par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Upholding is at the time of cultivation, for the sake of stabilizing the mind.

original: 'di'o 'di la'o zhes bya ba ni rten dang snang bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'o 'di la'o zhes bya ba ni rten dang snang bar gyur ba'o //
translated: This and this is the basis and what appears.

original: 'dis so zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'dis so zhes bya ba ni snang bar gyur pas so //
translated: This is the one is because of the appearance.

original: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: The aspect is the characteristic.

original: dper na ba glang ni nog dang lkog shal dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dper na ba glang ni nog dang lkog shal dang ldan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: For example, an ox is characterized by a dewlap and a hump.

original: rtags dang zhes bya ba ni bcos mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: rtags dang zhes bya ba ni bcos mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign is the artificial sign.

original: dper na ba glang ni bum pa la sogs pas so//
analyzed: dper na ba glang ni bum pa la sogs pas so//

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin can gyi mtshan ma ste /

analyzed: dper na ba glang dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: For example, an ox is characterized by being white, etc.

original: bstan pa ni gzhan gyi phyir gzhan las nyan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gzhan gyi phyir gzhan las nyan pa'o //
translated: The teaching is listening to another from another for the sake of instruction.

original: lan ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reply is it is not so, etc.

original: 'di ni phung po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya bas na ji srid du chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba'am zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen gsungs pa ni chos thams cad de rnams nyid kyis 'di las rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan na yang med par zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin te de'i don dam pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: And also because of the non-existence of anything else, i.e., because of the non-existence of anything other than that, because of the ultimate reality of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i dri ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i dri ba'o //

translated: Solitary means that the dependent is solitary by virtue of being devoid of the imagined.

original: zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la yongs su grub pa ni phung po la sogs pa kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la yongs su grub pa ni phung po la sogs pa kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of being peaceful means that the perfected is not perceived by the natures of the imagined and the dependent, such as the aggregates.

original: de bas na chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the non-perception of all phenomena is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang 'di ni stong pa nyid ces gzung ba nyid kyis dmigs par gyur na de ltar na yang 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang 'di ni stong pa nyid ces gzung ba nyid kyis dmigs par gyur na de ltar na yang 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the emptiness of the aggregates, etc., and this emptiness were perceived by being taken as objects, then it would not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach this, he says when one does not perceive and so on.

original: 'dis ni stong pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'on kyang ji srid du ma rtogs pa de srid du stong pa nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'on kyang ji srid du ma rtogs pa de srid du stong pa nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that emptiness is the perfection of wisdom, but as long as it is not realized, it is called emptiness.

original: gang gi ste mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis de rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes zhes sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brjod pa yin
analyzed: gang gi ste mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis de rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes zhes sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis brjod pa yin
translated: When it is realized by the wisdom that abides in the nature of the object observed and the observer being equal, then it is called the perfection of wisdom by the nature of accomplishment.

original: no // de ltar na gang zhig ji ltar yod pa dang ji ltar med pa ji ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'am mi 'gyur ba de thams cad la yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i
analyzed: no // de ltar na gang zhig ji ltar yod pa dang ji ltar med pa ji ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'am mi 'gyur ba de thams cad la yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi phyin pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'i
translated: Thus, for all those who are or are not, who exist or do not exist, who are or are not the perfection of wisdom, it is the perfection of wisdom because it is the correct realization of all.

original: phyir ro // 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pas ci thams cad nyid la 'di la lhag par mos pa nye bar skyed pa yang na 'ga' zhig la zhes 'dri bar byed pa ni ji srid cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pas ci thams cad nyid la 'di la lhag par mos pa nye bar skyed pa yang na 'ga' zhig la zhes 'dri bar byed pa ni ji srid cig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The answer is, For how long, etc.

original: 'di la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa thob pa'o //
translated: The one who practices this is the one who has attained meditative concentration.

original: rnam par phye ste ji ltar rnam par phye zhe na yun ring po ji srid cig tshul bsrungs pa 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba @140b 'ga' zhig la ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ste ji ltar rnam par phye zhe na yun ring po ji srid cig tshul bsrungs pa 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba @140b 'ga' zhig la ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it analyzed? It is analyzed as to whether it arises for some [beings] or not, for how long a time, and for how long one has maintained the way.

original: de bas na ci'i phyir dbang po'i rim pa yod pas sna tshogs pa nyid kyis de gsungs pa ni rab 'byor yang rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de bas na ci'i phyir dbang po'i rim pa yod pas sna tshogs pa nyid kyis de gsungs pa ni rab 'byor yang rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Therefore, why is it taught as various due to the existence of different faculties? It is said, Subhuti, by what method, etc.

original: sngon yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thad nas zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: sngon yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thad nas zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: It is also said, Previously, in the presence of those Buddha Bhagavans, etc. This is an alternative reading.

original: de la sangs rgyas de rnams kyis ston pa 'di la sangs rgyas de dag gi thad nas 'di la gus par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas de rnams kyis ston pa 'di la sangs rgyas de dag gi thad nas 'di la gus par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
translated: In this regard, the Buddhas, in the presence of the Teacher, have respect for him.

original: thad nas zhes bya ba ni nye ba la'o //
analyzed: thad nas zhes bya ba ni nye ba la'o //
translated: In the presence means in the vicinity.

analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba'i don rnams las zhes bya bas lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth case is indicated by the words from the meanings of far and near.

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is in the presence of the Buddhas.

analyzed: ma gus pa nyid ni bsnyen bkur bya ba nyid ma yin pa dad par bya ba nyid ma yin pa bcom ldan 'das ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba nyid ma yin pa sangs rgyas rnams la yongs su 'dri bar byed pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect means not being worthy of veneration, not being worthy of faith, not being worthy of service to the Blessed One, and not being worthy of questioning the Buddhas.

original: de nas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i gnas las 'byol ba'o //
analyzed: de nas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i gnas las 'byol ba'o //
translated: Then, he turns away from the place where the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i las kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: By karma in conformity with the loss of the Dharma, etc.

original: chos kyis ni dam pa'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyis ni dam pa'i chos kyis so //
translated: By the Dharma means by the true Dharma.

analyzed: nye bar mi phongs pa la spong ba'o // spong ba la phyin ci log pa'i don rtogs pa'o //
translated: One does not approach poverty due to the lack of faith, etc.

analyzed: de 'di las 'byung bas na chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las so // dam pa'i chos spang par byas pa ni lan cig byas pas so //
